page.title: 18THE CHURCH
page.content: IN 1239 a monk called Jocii arrived in Cotgrave and built the first church. When he died he was buried near the twin pillars he designed. In 1346 the church became a chantry, that is a place where songs were sung. In 1412 John Grenlow had a spire built. The villagers were not happy because they were expected to pay for it. In 1900 the new organ was first played.In 1967 the church was completely redecorated, water was piped into the church, the bell and the clock tower treated for deathwatch beetle and the hall lit by beautiful chandeliers. The approach to the church was also tarmaced. All this was achieved by the villagers giving freely and organising functions to raise the money, so the building that was first built in 1246 continues to grow and prosper.
